title: Valentype | Declare your love for a FontFont and win the FontFont you love!
content:
14 entries so far for the [Valentype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=272) contest on [Unzipped](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.fontshop.be/). We need at least four times this number. Get off your collective heinies — it’d be a shame if we’d have to call the whole thing off due to lack of submissions. ;^)

 [‹ Webheads - A Call for Help](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42999 "Go to previous forum topic") [CID (Identity-H) encoded fonts in PDF ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43259 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Well, although my entry sucks, I entered.

“ends tomorrow (Friday) night February 15th at midnight”

What time zone?

“call the whole thing off due”

Maybe consider just extending the deadline?

It’s kinda shifty to cancel contests unless there are absolutely no entries.

But I’m going to enter when I get home from work!
Three entries each! Do it! My three are up there.

About 50 minutes left.  
Yves seems to have problems uploading the entries.  
(my last one isn’t there yet.)

But hey, if it doesn’t sum up to 60 entries nobody’s gonna win.  
So do it!

I just submitted one. If I have time, I’ll make another later tonight.

- Lex

Oh - right. Midnight comes at a different time over there :-) I’ll have to work fast.

- Lex

OK. I got 2 entries in. That’s it for me.

- Lex

Let’s say midnight worldwide, so we have until Tonga and Samoa. I’ll duke it out with the boss if we’re a couple of entries short. ;^)

There’s some absolutely terrific stuff being submitted, both in the image and text categories, and I’m gutted by the fact that for now no new images can be posted. I’m adding all the submissions even if the related image can’t be added yet. This way you can keep track if your entry was received: if you see your name and the typeface name in the list you’re good.

Thanks to everyone who’s already submitted and keep ’em coming.

Yves, could you please remove the blue line around the images?  
It really messes up all the wonderful entries.

This is the first I have heard of it. I guess I am too late to submit.

ChrisL
Midnight worldwide Chris! You can do it!
Wait, Nick Shinn loves FF Fontesque? What’s that all about?

you got ’til midnight Tonga time.

-=®=-
How do I win, anyway? Is it by my brilliant submission or just luck of the draw?

Brilliant submission.

Nick, I fear I have no power over the blue lines. Talk to [them](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.group94.be/). :^P

I decided I would rather do a gothic poem about Fakir. But since it doesn’t count in the contest I’ll post it here.

In the same strain of Roland will I tell  
Things unattempted yet in prose or rhyme  
On whom strange serif and kern fury fell  
A font esteemed so wise in former time;  
If design, who to like cruel pass has well.  
Night brought my interrupted design  
By hourly wastes, my senses concede my skill  
But strength my daring promise to fulfill.

Different weights it drives, and evermore  
Strong design, conceptual, historic cries  
And it’s presence up-leading on the shore  
And Fakir her lovely visage spies  
Epic story, epic battles, epic wins  
Arriving quickly to the designers eyes  
(Through many days no news of her had shown)  
The beautiful Fakir is known.

And be she cheap with all except the weights.  
“Use Papyrus” The client did bestow  
Ah! False and cruel Fortune! foul despite!  
While others triumph, I am drown’d in woe  
And can it be that I treasure such slight  
And can I then my very Fakir forego?  
No! Let me die; it this a sign?  
A long life; if I must cease to design.

I just emailed my 3 entries at 8:30 PM EST.

ChrisL
Yes! That means we have our 50.

+ 3 from me

-=®=-

I must have done something wrong, they have not shown up yet on the site as posted.

ChrisL
My image never showed up but I have to say I did it in about 10 minutes so I can’t say it was my finest work... I’d love to get Atma tho!

I missed out. :(

BTW, whose lips are those in the banner image? Purrrrrrrrr...

I just sent mine in, and I’m claiming Honolulu time, which at the moment is about 11:55PM Friday!! I came up with something called Valentype Card Co. - Bastard Even Fatter!! using the ace of hearts as my subject matter done in a distressed/grunge technique.

I hope my entry helps the total number get up near enough to 60, it would be a shame to waste all those great entries.
Actually your entry _was_ number 60, 5 minutes before deadline. Hooray for Neill who saved the day! :^)
The major technical issues with the image library have been solved, but there still are severe speed issues. Sorry this is taking so long. :^/

_Wait, Nick Shinn loves FF Fontesque? What’s that all about?_

All will be revealed when/if the graphic is posted.

Too late — it’s already online. ;^)

All entries have now been uploaded and placed in the gallery. Let me know which one you think is the best.
Nick, if I win FF Oneleigh, I promise to Oneleigh use it for a good cause :)

I kind of like the Platters version, Dan :-)

[http://www.lyricsmania.com/lyrics/platters\_the\_lyrics\_3946/other\_lyrics\_...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.lyricsmania.com/lyrics/platters_the_lyrics_3946/other_lyrics_11676/only_you_lyrics_135433.html "http://www.lyricsmania.com/lyrics/platters\_the\_lyrics\_3946/other\_lyrics\_11676/only\_you\_lyrics\_135433.html")

ChrisL

Drat - I went and blew the size limits.

-=®=-

Ouch...bummer, Russel.

Some nice entries! That was fun.

All rush and no hurry.

-=®=-
I’m really sorry Russel, but my “boss” told me I could only do the competition if I didn’t have to do any extra work, because it already was quite demanding. Maybe next time.

No problem, Yves.  
rules is rules.

-=®=-

The best, by far:  
**43** | Florian Hardwig loves FF Angie

Aha, but you love the pretty laydeez... ;^) It indeed is one of the better ones.

The jury’s still out; it’s a really tough decision.
How come you never posted the results?

Dan, the winner has been declared in the comments of the [original Unzipper thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045407/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=272): It’s Ruben David Marques for his FF Legato entry.
ACHTUNG! I didn’t win! Next time.

The Legato one was the best choice in my opinion as well—not that a good string of well placed puns usually appeals to me :-)

ChrisL
